DataElement.preferredName: Intraocular Pressure Outcome Or Uncontrolled Glaucoma Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response to determine patient eligibility for clinical trial participation as outlined in the protocol for questions related to IOP results, or increased pressure in the eyeball due to obstruction of the outflow of aqueous humor that is not controlled.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Intraocular Pressure Outcome Or Uncontrolled Glaucoma Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The fluid pressure within the eye._The result of an action._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Not controlled, regulated, or constrained._Increased pressure in the eyeball due to obstruction of the outflow of aqueous humor._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The fluid pressure within the eye.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is patient's intraocular pres
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient's intraocular pressure (IOP) greater than 21 mmHg or uncontrolled glaucoma (irrespective of IOP)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known intraocular pressure (IOP) greater than 21 mmHg (or ULN adjusted by age) or uncontrolled glaucoma (irrespective of IOP)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have intraocular pressure greater than 21 mmHg (or ULN adjusted by age) or uncontrolled glaucoma (irrespective of IOP)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have uncontrolled glaucoma with intra-ocular pressures greater than or equal to 21 mmHg?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have known uncontrolled glaucoma with intra-ocular pressures greater than or equal to 21 mmHg?
